about.headerSub: passed down from generation to generation
about.history1: With over 46 years of experience in ceramic production, we create handmade Troyan ceramics with attention to every detail. We are a family business founded by Plamen and Tanya Ilievi, and today their daughters - Radina and Ilina - work side by side with them, continuing the family tradition and love for the craft. All products are created entirely by hand - from shaping on the potter's wheel to final details, without the use of machine production. We use only certified and high-quality materials.
about.history2: Our ceramics are offered and valued by customers around the world, and our craftsmanship is featured in various television programs dedicated to Bulgarian traditions and crafts. We offer household and souvenir Troyan ceramics that bring comfort, tradition and authentic atmosphere to your home. Our rich assortment and proven quality are a guarantee of durability and satisfaction.
about.history3: The production of our ceramics is an entirely manual process that has preserved the traditions of the Troyan craft through generations. Each piece is shaped on a potter's wheel with attention to detail, patience and craftsmanship accumulated over the years.
about.history4: We use only certified and high-quality materials that guarantee strength, safety and durability of the products. All stages - from shaping and drying, through decoration and glazing, to firing - are done by hand, without the use of machine production.
about.history5: Thanks to this approach, each piece is unique and carries its own character, warmth and authenticity. It is the handmade work that makes our ceramics not just an object, but part of Bulgarian tradition and home comfort.

howItWorks.headerSub: to the final product in your home
howItWorks.intro: The process of making each piece is entirely manual and takes approximately 20 days - from initial preparation to the final finished stage.

step1.title: Clay Preparation
step1.subtitle: We select and prepare clay with appropriate density and elasticity for manual processing

step2.title: Shaping on Potter's Wheel
step2.subtitle: The piece is shaped by hand on a potter's wheel and acquires its basic form

step3.title: Finishing and Smoothing
step3.subtitle: Fine corrections and smoothing of details are performed

step4.title: Decoration (Painting)
step4.subtitle: Each piece is decorated by hand with traditional Troyan ornaments

step5.title: First Firing
step5.subtitle: After decoration, the piece is fired to become strong and durable

step6.title: Glazing
step6.subtitle: Glaze is applied, which gives a finished look, color and protection

step7.title: Second Firing
step7.subtitle: The glaze and decoration are fixed and the final result is achieved

step8.title: Quality Control and Packaging
step8.subtitle: Each piece is carefully checked and prepared for customers

howItWorks.usage1: The clay pot is suitable for cooking dishes in the oven. Place the pot in a cold oven, then heat it gradually.
howItWorks.usage2: Avoid sudden temperature changes. Do not place a hot pot on a cold or wet surface to prevent thermal shock.
howItWorks.usage3: The pot is suitable for use in a microwave oven. It can be cleaned in a dishwasher.
howItWorks.usage4: Not suitable for direct contact with open fire or stovetop.

faq.header: Clear explanations of how we work,
faq.headerSub: what we use and what you can expect
faq.q1: Can the ceramic pot be used in the oven?
faq.a1: Yes, it is suitable for use in the oven. Place it in a cold oven and heat gradually.
faq.q2: Is it suitable for microwave oven?
faq.a2: Yes, the ceramic pot can be used in a microwave oven.
faq.q3: Can it be washed in a dishwasher?
faq.a3: Yes, the pot is suitable for cleaning in a dishwasher.
faq.q4: Can it be used on a stovetop or open fire?
faq.a4: No, it is not suitable for direct contact with a stovetop or open fire.
faq.q5: Should it be placed in a preheated oven?
faq.a5: No. It is recommended to place the pot in a cold oven to avoid thermal shock.
faq.q6: How to avoid cracking the pot?
faq.a6: Avoid sudden temperature changes and do not place a hot pot on cold or wet surfaces.
faq.q7: Are ceramic pots safe for food?
faq.a7: Yes, the materials used are suitable for contact with food.
faq.a8: Yes, ceramics retain heat for a long time and help with even cooking.
faq.q9: Can it be used for serving?
faq.a9: Yes, ceramic pots are suitable for both cooking and serving.
faq.q10: Is there a difference between clay and ceramics?
faq.a10: Clay is a natural material, while ceramics is processed and fired clay, suitable for household use.
